title: 114_s2526
content: The Act titled "Made in America Manufacturing Communities Act of 2016" establishes a program to designate and support manufacturing communities. The Act establishes a program to improve US manufacturing competitiveness by designating and supporting manufacturing communities. The Secretary of Commerce establishes a program to enhance US manufacturing competitiveness by designating consortiums as manufacturing communities and providing support to these communities. The program enhances US manufacturing competitiveness by designating consortiums as manufacturing communities and providing preferential consideration for financial or technical assistance to members of these communities under subsection (c). When a member of a consortium seeks financial or technical assistance from a participating agency, the agency head may prioritize them if it aligns with the consortium's economic development strategy and the member meets all requirements. The participating agencies for the program are the Department of Agriculture and the Department of Commerce. The participating agencies for the financial or technical assistance program include the Department of Agriculture, Commerce, Defense, Education, Energy, Housing and Urban Development, and Labor. The Department of Defense, Education, Energy, Housing and Urban Development, Labor, Transportation, Appalachian Regional Commission, Delta Regional Authority, Environmental Protection Agency, and National Science Foundation are participating agencies in the financial or technical assistance program. The Department of Labor, Transportation, Appalachian Regional Commission, Delta Regional Authority, Environmental Protection Agency, National Science Foundation, and Small Business Administration are participating agencies in the program.
